page.title: 08Country Living
page.content: The{rural home}of the 1980's is usually a{busy place,}father working at home or quite nearby, mother busy in the kitchen or helping outside and the children at school for most of the day. As children start school at 5 continuing until the age of 16,{home {life reaches its premium during the {school holidays.}Then the{whole family {work as a team,}down to the youngest member of the family, each having a job to do. Although all homes have a television they rarely sit to watch it,life is too busy, it is watched more during the dark winter months than in summertime. This is where the video recorder comes into its own, favourite programmes being recorded for watching at a more convenient time.
